de.sciss.swingosc
Class DummyTransferHandler

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.TransferHandler
      de.sciss.swingosc.DummyTransferHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Transferable, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, Serializable, EventListener, MouseInputListener
public class DummyTransferHandler
extends TransferHandler
implements Transferable, MouseInputListener

A proxy transfer handler to attach to any swing gadget ; the actual drag+drop handling should be done by the OSC client.

How it works: You create a DummyTransferHandler for a JComponent registered with the SwingOSC server. When the user initiates a drag gesture with this component being the drag source, an OSC message 

        [ "/transfer", <objectID>, "export" ]
is sent to the client who created the transfer handler. This client should then immediately reply with a 
        [ "/set", <transferHandlerID>, \string, <stringRepresentation> ]#
message if it wishes that the component's drag content can be exported to other applications as a string ; otherwise it should set that string to null, sending 
        [ "/set", <transferHandlerID>, \string, [ "/ref", \null ]]

On the other hand, if a string is dragged onto the JComponent, a message 

        [ "/transfer", <objectID>, "import", "string", <draggedString> ]
is sent to the client. If the drag-and-drop happens within SwingOSC, using two JComponents with two DummyTransferHandlers, instead the message 
        [ "/transfer", <objectID>, "import", "dummy" ]
is sent ; in this case the client is assumed to have recognized the most recent export message and "knows" what kind of object is being transferred. Have a look at the SuperCollider class JSCView and its usage of the currentDrag field to find out how this works.

Note that this class encompasses both the handler and the transferable. This will never generate separate transferables which means that setting the stringData to a value will always effect the ongoing drag-and-drop!

Version:
0.40, 25-Mar-06
Author:
Hanns Holger Rutz

Constructor Detail

DummyTransferHandler

public DummyTransferHandler(Object objectID,
                            int modifiers)
Creates and registers a new transfer handler for an existing JComponent. This will also start listening to mouse events fired from that component and initiate a drag export automatically when a mouse drag with the specified modifier keys occurs.

Parameters:
objectID - SwingOSC reference pointing to a JComponent object
modifiers - mask of modifiers that need to be pressed to initiate a drag ; like 2 for InputEvent.CTRL_MASK, or 8 for InputEvent.ALT_MASK
Throws:
ClassCastException - if objectID doesn't denote a JComponent
Method Detail

add

public void add()

remove

public void remove()

setString

public void setString(String s)
Sets the string representation of the Transferable. This allows the drag to be exported to other applications in the operating system.

Parameters:
s - the string representation or null to disallow the drag to be exported to the OS
